name: Spawning Substrate Quality
functionStatement: Physical and chemical conditions enable spawning, juvenile growth, migration, and stress survival of target taxa.
descriptionMarkdown: Clean gravel/vegetation is present if historically expected, unless alternative spawning is normal.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Assess percent of clean gravel or other suitable spawning substrate for target species and note fine sediment cover.

inputs.label: Spawning Substrate Quality
inputs.helpMarkdown: High resolution aerial imagery; Field photos; Brief field recon;

levels.label: Good
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: Clean or appropriate substrate with minimal silt. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Fair
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Some silt but still feasible for spawning. / Heavily silted with limited spawning success expected. (Suggested index range 0.40-0.69)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: No suitable substrate. High embeddedness, bedrock, or other limiting condition. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.39)

references: EPA Water Quality Portal (turbidity/TSS where available)
